dataset.name: University of Delaware Air Temperature and Precipitation v5.01
dataset.documentation:
Cort Willmott & Kenji Matsuura of the University of Delaware have put data together from a large number of stations, both from the GHCN2 (Global Historical Climate Network) and, more extensively, from the archive of Legates & Willmott. The result is a monthly climatology of precipitation and air temperature, both at the surface, and a time series of monthly mean surface air temperatures, and monthly total precipitation. It is land-only in coverage, and complements the ICOADS (International Comprehensive Ocean-Atmosphere Data Set) data set well.
Reference: Willmott, C. J. and K. Matsuura (2001) Terrestrial Air Temperature and Precipitation: Monthly and Annual Time Series (1950 - 1999)

dataset.name: GHCN CAMS and GPCC v2022
dataset.documentation:
GHCN CAMS is a high resolution (0.5x0.5) analyzed global land surface temperatures from 1948 to near present. GHCN Gridded V2 data provided by the NOAA/OAR/ESRL PSL, Boulder, Colorado, USA, from their Web site at https://psl.noaa.gov/
Reference: Fan, Y., and H. van den Dool (2008), A global monthly land surface air temperature analysis for 1948-present, J. Geophys. Res., 113, D01103.

GPCC Full Data Monthly Product of monthly global land-surface precipitation is based on the ~86,000 stations world-wide that feature record durations of 10 years or longer. The data coverage per month varies from ~20,000 (previous version 15,000) to more than 52,000 stations.
Reference: Schneider, Udo; Hänsel, Stephanie; Finger, Peter; Rustemeier, Elke; Ziese, Markus (2022): GPCC Full Data Monthly Product Version 2022 at 0.5°: Monthly Land-Surface Precipitation from Rain-Gauges built on GTS-based and Historical Data.
